def: {bc} a place where people live that is larger or more important than a town {bc} an area where many people live and work
{b}{it}the city{/it}{/b} {bc} the government of a city

dt: {bc}a place where people live that is larger or more important than a town {bc}an area where many people live and work

dt.t: major/big {it}cities{/it} like London, Tokyo, and Rome
ancient/modern {it}cities{/it}
the {it}city{/it} of Boston
{it}city{/it} dwellers/streets
a {it}city{/it} government
We spent the weekend in the {it}city{/it}. [=in the nearest big city]

dt: This sense is sometimes used in the name of a city.

dt.t: New York {it}City{/it}
Mexico {it}City{/it}
Kansas {it}City{/it}
I think the entire {it}city{/it} has heard the news by now.
The whole {it}city{/it} was excited about the football game.
{it}The city{/it} is working to make the streets safer.
a lawsuit against {it}the city{/it}

dt: {bc}the section of London that is Great Britain's financial and business center
used to describe a place where there is a lot of a particular thing or activity

dt.t: Their house was pet {it}city{/it}. [=there were a lot of pets in their house]
It was celebration {it}city{/it} [=there was a lot of celebration going on] at campaign headquarters last night!

dt: used to refer to a particular city without naming it

dt.t: I grew up on a farm, so my move to {it}the big city{/it} was a big change.
life in {it}the big city{/it}

shortdef: a place where people live that is larger or more important than a town : an area where many people live and work
the people in a city—usually singular

def: {bc} the center part of a large city

dt: {bc}the center part of a large city

dt.t: The {it}central city{/it} is losing population, while the suburbs are expanding.

shortdef: the center part of a large city

def: {bc} the central section of a large city where mostly poor people live

dt: {bc}the central section of a large city where mostly poor people live

dt.t: The mayor is trying to attract new businesses to the {it}inner city{/it}.

shortdef: the central section of a large city where mostly poor people live

def: {it}US{/it} {bc} one of two cities or towns in different areas that have a special relationship and are usually similar in some way

dt: {bc}one of two cities or towns in different areas that have a special relationship and are usually similar in some way

dt.t: A choir from our {it}sister city{/it} in France is performing here next week.

shortdef: one of two cities or towns in different areas that have a special relationship and are usually similar in some way —called also (British) twin town
